definition: everything for self and selfish profit (idiom); with no regard for others/selfish/mercenary

sentences.english: Some selfish Chinese politicians are considered to be "typhoid Marys " to their own people.
sentences.chinese: 一些自私自利的中国政客，是自己同胞祸害的根源。

sentences.english: May I not be selfish and self-possessive, but selfless and disinterested.
sentences.chinese: 愿我不自私自利，而是公正无私。

sentences.english: They are busy carrying food, but the ant colony and egoistic.
sentences.chinese: 它们忙着搬食物，但蚁群里也有自私自利的家伙。

sentences.english: You should reject this self-serving sympathy ploy.
sentences.chinese: 您应该拒绝这种自私自利的手段。

sentences.english: Adam is clever enough, but he s also something of an egomaniac.
sentences.chinese: 亚当足够聪明，但是他也有点自私自利。

sentences.english: Indeed, everyone knows it is utterly false and self-serving only.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，每个人都知道这是完全错误并且自私自利的。

sentences.english: One who is selfish is contemptible .
sentences.chinese: 自私自利的人是可鄙的。

sentences.english: Such comparisons are obviously specious and self-serving.
sentences.chinese: 这样的比较明显地华而不实，而且自私自利。
思想前瞻还是自私自利？

sentences.english: I was still the selfish bastard I always was.
sentences.chinese: 我一直都仍是个自私自利的杂种。

sentences.english: They only know the rules of a generation of self-seekers.
sentences.chinese: 他们只知道自私自利一代的信条。

sentences.english: Altruism is the opposite of selfishness .
sentences.chinese: 忘我主义的反面是自私自利。

sentences.english: Selfish heart, sign the barrier that the person reaches a person.
sentences.chinese: 自私自利之心，是立人达人之障。

definition: to seek nothing but profit (idiom); personal profit before everything/self-seeking
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations/to sell one's soul for gain
unable to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless
